column1: #Text=[0588] As is also disclosed in U.S.

#Text=No. 5,470,307, "In the case of balloon dilation catheters 10, creating a catheter body 12 capable of supporting a substrate layer 16 with enhanced surface area can be done by several means known to the art including altering conditions during balloon spinning, doping with appropriate monomers, applying secondary coatings such as polyethylene oxide hydrogel, branched polylysines, or one of the various Starburst..TM.. dendrimers offered by the Aldrich Chemical Company of Milwaukee, Wis."
#Text=[0589] As is also disclosed in U.S.

#Text=No. 5,470,307, "The most likely materials for the substrate layer 16 in the case of a dilation balloon catheter 10 or similar apparatus are shown in FIGS. 1a-1g, including synthetic or natural polymers such as polyamide, polyester, polyolefin (polypropylene or polyethylene), polyurethane, and latex.
